title: (x) typolexikon.de - Adobe Jenson {Mark S}
content:
Hi all,   
   
can someone please help me identify this font?   
Sorry, the sample is very small, maybe someone recognizes some characters like the B or G?   
   
 ![Font question](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107181653im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/28764.gif)   
   
This font can be found on this page:   
   
 [http://www.typolexikon.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107181653/http:/www.typolexikon.de/)   
   
Thank you very much in advance for your help!

 [‹ (x) washingtonpost.com - Futura {Chesh}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107181653/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3659 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Tales from the Powder Room - TF Forever Two {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107181653/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3653 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jojo

comments.content:
I thought it might be ITC Berkeley Old Style, but now   
I'm not so sure anymore... it really is too small.
I'm thinking it might be Adobe Jenson.

Yeah, that darn sure looks like it. The only thing that   
bugs me is the linked ".de" on the home page. Do you   
think they used the same face? Because that's _not_  
Adobe Jenson.   
   
Are you happy with Mark's ID, Edward?

The ".de" appears to be a Garamond. [Garamond No. 5 Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107181653/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/garamond-no-5/ef-light-italic/testdrive.html?s=.de&p=48) is pretty close.
The sans serif appears to be [Engravers' Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20080107181653/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/engravers-gothic/engravers-gothic/testdrive.html?s=typolexikon&p=48).

Thank you very much!   
It's only the "B" in that text that doesn't look like ITC Berkeley Old Style or Adobe Jenson. Strange!
That's probably due to the bitmapping at low resolution.
